Class Fragment

java.lang.Object
  Fragment

public class Fragment
extends java.lang.Object

A Fragment object has on-screen coordinates and intended size and an image to be displayed. You may ADD functionality to this class, but ensure that you do not change the existing method signatures.

Version:
March 2014
Author:
Rachel Cardell-Oliver

Constructor Detail

Fragment

public Fragment(java.lang.String keywords,
                int xpos,
                int ypos,
                java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
Construct a Fragment object for a Collage. By default, the size (width and height) of the Fragment is the same as the image but the desired drawing size can be changed later.

Parameters:
keywords - String of words to identify this fragment eg. "blue, nature". The name need not be unique eg. could use color as info for tile pictures. The keyword string may include commas or spaces for multiple keywords.
xpos - int position co-ordinate
ypos - int position co-ordinate
image - BufferedImage picture for this fragment

                          int newHeight)

Parameters:

newHeight - No error checking is done for these parameters so they can be larger than image
